import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from datetime import datetime
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

%matplotlib inline

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = [12,6]
plt.rcParams['figure.dpi'] = 70
sns.set_theme(style='white')
sns.set_palette(palette='Spectral')

source.1b93c684:
In business, a **unicorn** is a privately held startup company valued at over $1 billion. The term was first popularised in 2013 by venture capitalist Aileen Lee, choosing the mythical animal to represent the statistical rarity of such successful ventures.

This dataset is a tidied up version of https://www.kaggle.com/ramjasmaurya/unicorn-startups/ shared by @ramjasmaurya
source.88f9ea7b: Clearly, 2021 was the year of the unicorn. I'm curious which companies started earliest.
source.9c03c5ba: Interesting to see they mostly follow a set line, but there are few outliers. The most valuable unicorns don't seem to follow this trend at all.
source.94f2db31: We see that the vast majority of unicorns reside in the US (51%).
source.9d0185d4:
Qustions:
- What company are the most valuable?
- What industry are the most valuable?
- What is the segmentation of industry?
- What country produces the most unicorns?
- Which unicorn had the steepest rise?
- Which investors are most succeful?

source.46863764: We see the astronomical rise in value of especially Fintech and Internet software & services in the last 5 years.
source.f02b7fd3: Close to 25% of the total market value is in Fintech. The top 3 biggest industries make up more than 50% of total market value ($1540 Billion)
